Text:
Brittany Wenger, taught herself to code in middle school. At 15, her cousin was diagnosed with breast cancer so she created Cloud4Cancer, an AI breast cancer app that took first place in the 2012 Google Science Fair. Brittany successfully trained the network to have a 99.11% accuracy rate in determining whether a sample of breast tissue is malignant or benign. She is now studying at Duke University.

We can't wait to see what you'll do next!

Baltimore Third Grader, Paxton Summers, wins NASA's and Tynker's "Mission Design Patch Challenge" coding contest. Nice work!
Have you created something from the Art or Maker pathway? Send us a photo and we will feature our favorites in the newsfeed.
Hey everyone! We‚Äôre going to pull back the curtain for a minute here, because something really cool is happening!
That‚Äôs right, Ada. Hack is coming to Pepcom! Pepcom is a mini-conference that showcases new and upcoming software and tech to the media!
That‚Äôs pretty cool by itself, but what that means for YOU, our community, is that we‚Äôre going to be in front of a ton of journalists!
Exactly, Ada. Expect to see articles about Hack and Endless coming out soon! If you‚Äôve got friends, family, or anyone else you want to share Hack with, this is your moment.
Yep! We‚Äôre hoping to see the Hack community grow even more in the near future ‚Äì We‚Äôre rolling out content updates and expanding our reach every month!
wow that‚Äôs gonna be a lot more remote students, huh?
Indeed. I think we‚Äôll be able to cope, though ‚Äì We have a good, solid structure in place for them.
I can‚Äôt wait to meet more kids through Hack!
this is gonna be so awesome!
From all of us here at Hack ‚Äì Thanks for sticking with us so far, and let‚Äôs keep learning about coding together. Hack the planet!
Ethan taught himself to code in about three months during the summer, published over 3 apps, spoke at SXSW, and just won a 10k scholarship from Amazon. Way to go, Ethan!
Ahhh, I always get such a feeling of freedom every New Year!
A New Year is a momentous time. Many cultures throughout history have placed great significance on the end of the old year and the beginning of the new.
staying up late is pretty cool
but i just hang with my friends online lol
New Years‚Äô seems to be a time when everyone in the world is doing the same thing at the same time ‚Äì Think about how rare that is!
@Ada Isn‚Äôt January 1st your birthday?
Oh! Yes, yes it is, Estelle. I just tend to wrap it up in all the other celebrations, there‚Äôs so much to celebrate!
@Ada that‚Äôs an interesting birthday, bet there aren‚Äôt too many people who share that one with you.
@Ada heh did your parents let you choose if it was jan 1st or december 31st?
@Riley I don‚Äôt recall having any choice in the matter, but then again I don‚Äôt recall what time I was born.
Anyway, it‚Äôs nice having a birthday today, I get to celebrate both the year and myself. We‚Äôre both starting another trip around the sun at the same time!
crazy to think of exactly WHAT a new year means ‚Äì just another swing around that lucky old sun of ours.
@Faber You know, we‚Äôre not really even close to the same place we were a year ago, in terms of space. The entire galaxy has rotated in that time.
woah
@Riley nuts, right?
And yet, it seems like we‚Äôve never moved at all. Perspective is everything.
@Saniel Exactly! This is the perfect time to try and find a new one on the coming 365 days.
Speaking of which, does everyone have New Years‚Äô resolutions?
@Ada eat more chocolate
ok no seriously, solve more mysteries. for real.
@Ada I‚Äôm planning on examining my beliefs and personal truths, and cataloging them to find out which ones I think are most important.
@Ada I‚Äôm going spend this year trying to make the Academy the best it can be. We‚Äôve got a great future here, I know it!
@Ada being the best friend I can be to all of you. that‚Äôs always been one of the most important things for me.
Wow, those are some pretty powerful resolutions! I have one of my own, too. This year‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm going to try to take more risks, and be more open to the powers of luck and coincidence.
@Ada grab life as it comes at you, and hold on tight! we‚Äôre all here to back you up.
@Faber Thanks. It means a lot to me to have friends like all of you.
Hacking for the holidays? Share your favorite holiday hacks on social media by tagging your post with #MadeToHack. We'll share our favs in our newsletter.
Samaira started coding at 6 and at the age of 8, she created a game to teach kids to code. Now a CEO of her own company, there's nothing she can't accomplish.
From all of us at Endless - We hope you have a Happy Holidays!
Hey everyone at The Academy! I want to wish you all a Merry Christmas, and any other holiday you‚Äôd like to celebrate as we come to the end of the year!
@Ada man, I love the end of the year, so many great times and parties to throw.
@Ada oh heck yes christmas break here I come
@Ada Have a Happy Holidays, Ada.
@Ada Have a great time with your vacation! Are you planning a trip, or anything?
@Estelle Oh, no, I‚Äôm not a big fan of traveling. But I do have a large backlog of research journals to catch up on, so I‚Äôm looking forward to getting a lot of uninterrupted reading time.
@Ada bwahhh spending your entire vacation reading journals, dang
@Riley Research journals are quite relaxing for me, much like your favorite graphic novels, Riley.
@Ada nah I wasn‚Äôt trying to say they were bad, it just sounds like work to me when you‚Äôre supposed to be on vaycay
sometimes ‚Äòwork‚Äô can be pretty relaxing. remember when we built that little bugbot, @Riley?
@Faber oh yeah that was great
@Riley yeah, and we were really going hard on that for 2 weeks, at least an hour a day every day. didn‚Äôt feel like work, did it?
@Faber except when we were soldering those tiny sensors‚Ä¶ ugh
@Riley Highly skillful effort can be just as rewarding as leisure, Riley. The more experienced you are, the more a problem seems like an opportunity to learn and improve.
@Estelle and I guess thats why you‚Äôre always doing orbital calculations lol
@Riley Well, that and curiosity!
It‚Äôs so nice to have some time to yourself. What‚Äôs everyone‚Äôs favorite holiday drink?
@Ada glogg! it‚Äôs Swedish and boy, it is good!
@Ada uhhhh hot chocolate, of course
@Ada I personally prefer a nice mulled wine. Quite soothing.
@Ada Cafe Borgia, for me. I know it‚Äôs not strictly holiday, but it reminds me of pomanders, one of my favorite holiday decorations.
@Estelle po-what-ders?
@Riley Pomanders - Oranges with cloves stuck in them. They smell wonderful!
@Estelle i wonder how many weird holiday decos I could make by shoving random spices and stuff into fruits
@Faber Hide the lemons!
@Ada lemons? hide the grapefruit!
@Riley I suppose I can donate a few apples to becoming spice pincushions.
@Saniel udabest
@Riley ‚Ä¶ is that a city? Like Budapest?
@Saniel lol
@Saniel Haha!
@Saniel XD
@Saniel Now there‚Äôs a true Christmas gift ‚Äì a joke from Saniel Rowe. Happy Holidays, everyone!
Are you a Lego maniac? Create your own Lego design and built it in real life with this design application. Tag #MadeToHack on your designs and we'll like our favs.
At the age of 7, Kedar Narayan is solving real-world problems with code. Check out his Ted talk as he explains how he invented Storibot, a code-based board game for the blind.
@Faber Hello, Faber. Is this how you send a private message?
@Saniel yep. what‚Äôs up, doc?
@Saniel sorry! couldn‚Äôt resist XD
@Faber ‚Ä¶ Yes. I have a‚Ä¶ research question that I‚Äôd like another perspective on.
@Saniel any time! hope the subject is something I can help with
@Faber I hope so. The subject is‚Ä¶ personal in nature.
@Saniel personal? like, related to your previous research?
@Faber ‚Ä¶ Er, no. Personal. As in, relating to aspects of my personal life. I‚Äôm asking for this advice in a strictly non-professional capacity.
@Saniel want to make sure I got all this right
@Saniel you want my opinion on a personal question
@Sanilel about your personal life?
@Faber Yes.
@Saniel saniel rowe, are you asking me for dating advice???
@Faber NO!
@Faber ‚Ä¶That‚Äôs not strictly correct. I need advice on a gift.
@Saniel a gift?
@Faber It‚Äôs the holidays very soon, Faber. Traditionally, the holidays are when close friends and family exchange gifts, to promote goodwill and happiness in the coming year... (1/5)
@Saniel I found my calendar last month so I did remember the end of the year is coming up‚Ä¶ sorry to cut you off
@Faber Well. Apologies. I‚Äôm rambling.
@Saniel nah man I get you, it‚Äôs a tough decision. who‚Äôs the present for?

@Faber Well, she‚Äôs a very‚Ä¶ formidable woman. Quite intelligent. Very driven. She has a mischievous streak, definitely. I was thinking that she might appreciate a bound edition of the last 5 issues of The Journal Of Computational Linguistics ‚Äì very handy.
@Saniel uh, please don‚Äôt take this the wrong way, but that‚Äôs a terrible present.
@Faber What? How could that be so terrible? It‚Äôs a massively important journal for the field!

@Saniel totally, I know it is, but that present is from your outside. that‚Äôs the Saniel you show everyone. gifts should be from your heart, from the part you don‚Äôt show most people, that‚Äôs what makes them special!
@Faber I‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt quite see, but I think I get what you‚Äôre driving at. The gift should be‚Ä¶ unexpected?
@Saniel sort of, yeah, like in a way that shows you‚Äôre really paying attention to that person and what they like.
@Faber Hm. Then perhaps‚Ä¶ Yes. I have an idea.
@Saniel nice
@Saniel what‚Äôs cooking up there, dude?
@Faber I have decided. I assume you know of the Voyager probes?
@Saniel definitely. tiny little bits of hardware sailing off into the deep black‚Ä¶ some seriously good engineering on those things.

@Faber Yes, well, you know there was a golden record attached to one of those probes ‚Äì it contained greetings, music, and messages that tried to represent as much of Earth‚Äôs culture as possible. I‚Äôm going to create a copy. That will be my gift.
@Saniel awesome! that‚Äôs more like it, something unexpected, from the heart. great present!
@Faber Thank you, Faber, for your help.
@Saniel anytime. you already knew what to do, though. trust your feelings, doc, you‚Äôve got a good heart.
@Faber Well, if you say so. Now, to find a record-pressing company that does small runs...
Looking to create your own logos, icons and type for your Hack profile? Check out #Dotgrid! Tag us on your creations @MadeToHack. We can't wait to see what you've created.

When she was 7, Zora Ball, became the youngest individual to create a full version of a mobile game. Plus, she has also became a master of the Bootstrap programming language. Way to go, Zora. You're a rockstar! üî•üî•üî•
Loving our new Hack experience? We'd love to hear from you. Click the image to get to the feedback form, and we'll send a few lucky winners some Hack schwag. Good luck!

Got a skateboard and want to try a cool interactive hoverboard game made with JavaScript? Connect using your phone, place it on a skateboard and start moving to avoid obstacles! Share your high score @MadeToHack.
Making music on your Hack has never been easier. You only need 5 minutes to learn and they have a robust tutorial. It's free to download and use. Check it out.
Hack protip: Enhance your Blender learning experience by emulating a third mouse button? Check out our blog post for more information.
Love making music? How about making music using your webcam? Check out this Javascript sequencer that uses your body to generate music in real-time.
Happy holidays from your friends at Hack!
With Hack, you have access to a library of free apps from the Linux community. Go to your desktop and launch the 'More Apps' application and download a new app today!
Do you have a friend or family member who'd love Hack? The Hack laptop and key are on sale at Amazon. Tell your friends!

Embark on a journey that takes you all over the world. From the most desolate roads in Australia to the busy, bustling streets of New York City with the power of GoogleMaps. How close is your guess from the real location? Tell us your highest score and see where you rank amoung our Hack users.
Looking for new and interesting sites to explore? Check out our social posts Thursday and we'll share our favs.
Have you updated your Hack computer and started on the all new Hack experience? Check out our video on YouTube and learn how you can update your Hack from the terminal.

We've spent all summer working and rebuilt your Hack experience from the ground up! Download the latest update from the app store and launch Hack from the desktop. For a full overview of our changes, check out our blog post.

anybody out there craving some tasty chicken wings? sometimes it just HITS you! #midnightmunchies

Any suggestions for a great tea that goes with physics brain-teasers?
@Ada lol I wish I could stay awake with tea, gotta be a cafe mocha... mmm chocolate.
@Ada try some passion-fruit rooibos! That stuff'll get you charged up and ready to think big!
@Ada I'm a fan of mint tea for almost everything. Soothing, but won't put you to sleep.
@Ada Functionally-speaking, tea and coffee are the same - so deca-distilled coffee should help. 3-4 tablespoons can provide hours of heightened energy.
@Saniel holy jeebers, I gotta get me some of that, imagine how much STUFF I could get done!!!
@Riley ... I regret disclosing the existence of this substance.
